column4: I appologise if someone answered me and I missed it...  I'm having trouble with glxgears on Ubuntu 6.06 on AMD64.  I get the error:" X Error of failed request:  BadAlloc (insufficient resources for operation)"
It's a 32mb Radeon 7200, and I have a gig of of RAM.
Yeah, TWM is the ugliest VM available, but it's low requirements. :)  The next one up would be blackbox, IMO.
Cute car, but I can't read german. ^_^
My ATI display is fast enough, but my OopenGL is screwed.
does fglrx appear in the output of lsmod | grep fglrx
I'm not using the ATI drivers cause my card is too old.
It looks like I'm using the xorg radeon driver.
try sudo modprobe radeon (if it does not complain add radeon to the bottom of /etc/modules
Ok, one sec.  But I think it's already loaded.
If it is already loaded I don't know what to suggest sorry
I don't have one of those cards
It looks like the problem I have may be a bug.  Bug #45318:
